definition: to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: HanShan sitting under the cliff edge, night and day, JuShou river.
sentences.chinese: 韩珊坐在山崖下的河水边，昼夜据守。

sentences.english: In 1945 the forts were manned by Japanese soldiers determined to hold out to the bitter end.
sentences.chinese: 这些堡垒在1945年又被日本士兵们拼死据守。

definition: to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
(to resist the enemy) relying on inaccessible territory
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to hold a pass/to guard (a strategic location)
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
